ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to quickly adapt to the ever-changing nature of research, as well as how to manage my own time and my own work better

I gained technical skills in working with cells and tissue in the lab. I learnt to analyze samples and performed routine experiments. I also learnt to cater for different types of cells and how to set up a research project.
I learned how to work and time manage in an unguided setting. We worked on both the physical mechanical modeling as well as software (FEA analysis) as well.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think a lot of the senior project class depends on working on a project you enjoy, and finding a mentor who works with your style. I'm a person who likes some direction, but also a lot of independence to do my own work, so I got along very well with my mentor and I think I got the most out of the experience that I could, but for others it might be difficult to find a lab or project they're interested in
The syllabus could be posted a few months prior to the beginning of the semester so students know what to prepare for such as finding a mentor etc.

Strengths: we are allowed to choose our own projects which makes it much more meaningful! Professors are super helpful!
Weaknesses: none really!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This is very dependent on the project. If you have an interesting project, then yes! Prof. Duncan does require thorough project plans, midterm reports, and final reports.
This course is a great way to factor scientific research into academics and to gain very useful technical lab skills.
This is a requirement but definitely choose a project you rae interested in!
